> Alot of people just don't seem to understand just what a Bard can give to
a
> party. They think either think that a Bard sucks as a tank, or sucks at a
> healer, or sucks at something else, and there's always someone that could
do
> something better than a Bard! I recently tried to discuss the advantages
of
> a Bard in a party with some guy on the EQVault board, but he really didn't
> want to understand what I was saying about the advantages of Bards. Alot
of
> people have their own ideas on things, sometimes something happened to
them
> once, and they think it's a fact from that point onward, sometimes they
just
> like to believe in superstition. The thread on the boat crashing and it
> being Bard's fault is one example.
>
> I typically group with the same people all the time so I generally don't
run
> into these things, except possibly when we add another member. Maybe when
> they're joining they choose to keep their mouths shut a little bit more.
> ) But, I have been asked to not play Selo's when a Druid joins.... I
say,
> "Okay, NP, Can I get a SOW?" : ) IMO Sow is much better for saving a
party
> when things turn ugly, cause I don't have to stick around and make sure
> everyone's under the effects of my song. I've died numerous times this
way
> while saving the whole party.
>
> On the Jig... Every member of my regular party has said it helps. There
> hasn't been a stopwatch timing kinda thing going, but they still say they
> notice it. Every mana user that groups with us I ask if it helps too, and
I
> haven't heard even one person saying no. I'd say there's enuf people
saying
> Yes, it does, to warrant believing it. : )
>
